io.confluent.ksql.config

Interface ConfigResolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    KsqlConfigResolver

    public interface ConfigResolver
    A resolver of configuration names.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<ConfigItem> resolve(java.lang.String propertyName, boolean strict)
      Attempt to resolve the supplied propertyName.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        java.util.Optional<ConfigItem> resolve(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                       boolean strict)
        Attempt to resolve the supplied propertyName.

        The return value is tri-state.

        • Optional.empty() - indicating the property is know to be invalid/unknown.
        • ConfigItem.Resolved
          • - a known valid property. Such items can parse and validate potential values for the property and can obfuscate sensitive data.
        • ConfigItem.Unresolved
          • - a potentially valid property. Such items perform no parsing, validation or obfuscation.

        For strict resolution, only known configuration, i.e. those that map directly to an item in a ConfigDef instance, or UDF properties, i.e. those prefixed with KsqlConfig.KSQL_FUNCTIONS_PROPERTY_PREFIX, will be resolved. All others will result in empty.

        For non-strict resolution, only configuration known to be invalid, e.g. properties that are prefixed with ksql., but which are not known KSQL config, will result in empty.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to resolve.
        strict - if resolution should use strict mode or not.
